page.title: 16RELIGION IN STAMBOURNE 1
page.content: Stambourne's parish church (Church of England), St. Peter & St. Thomas, is just outside the area surveyed by this group. Stambourne shares a Rector with Toppesfield, and a new Rector was appointed in July 1985 after a vacancy of 3 years. He lives in Toppesfield. The building, which seats about 200, is almost full for the Harvest Festival and Christmas Carol Services, but the regular congregation numbers about 20. One service is held each Sunday. A Sunday School has just been started and numbers 18 children under eleven years of age. There is also a Congregational chapel which belongs to the Congregational Union; churches which preferred to remain independent when the United Reformed Church was set up in the early 1970's.
